scenario_text.value:
This is it! Finally. I’m just itching to do
this.
Just you wait. I am going all out today!
Wow, you’re really fired up, Kaito.

I hope you’re not scared, Takuma. You’ve got
to look out for yourself, you know?
Uh, yeah. Well, sure...

If you feel like you’re not ready yet, you
can train some more in the forest first.

No matter what we do, I don’t think anything
will change...
That’s right. And it’s us who’ll be fighting.

So the enemy won’t attack those of us who
can’t fight? Yeah, no.

Don’t be so naive.
In the end, you can only count on yourself.
If Kaito says so, maybe I should try too.
You’re the leader, after all.
Me? The leader? What makes you say that?
You’ve taken charge lately, right?

No one objected, so that makes you the
leader. It’s as simple as that.
(I’m the leader? I never thought of that.)

(I’m glad they all trust me, but that means
I gotta work that much harder.)
(Can I handle the responsibility?)
(Me...a leader?)
I can’t believe it.
I won’t let you down.
Don’t put that on me.
I can’t believe it.

It’s hard to believe. I’ve never been in
charge of anything before.

It’ll just take some getting used to, that’s
all.
Lead us well, Takuma!
I’ve got your back too!
Okay, then! Gotta at least try!
I won’t let you down.

A leader? Me?
I won’t let you down.

Yeah, I can see you like the sound of it.
Don’t let us down, man!
Okay, then. I’ll do what I can.
Don’t put that on me.

Well, I didn’t ask for that kind of
responsibility. Don’t you put that on me.

What kind of attitude is that? Nerves are one
thing, but you’re trying to get out of it?

Everyone’s counting on you, Takuma.
You can do better than that.
(It sounds like Kaito believes in me too.)
(That’s weird, but I’m kinda glad.)

With our trust comes the responsibility.
You’ve got this, though.
